messages: 951030ef4480e3a5cc395e77db5bd1ec (19:31): import done in CL8MSWIN1251 character set and AL16UTF16 NCHAR character set
951030ef4480e3a5cc395e77db5bd1ec (19:31): import server uses WE8ISO8859P1 character set (possible charset conversion)
951030ef4480e3a5cc395e77db5bd1ec (19:31): how do imp knows that server uses  WE8ISO8859P1 ?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:32): thats not really a problem generally
951030ef4480e3a5cc395e77db5bd1ec (19:32): hali, i'm getting '?????' instead of russian characters
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:32): you can possibly alter the server charset and ncharset ... if CL8MSWIN1251 is a superset of WE8ISO8859P1
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:33): it is sort of a hassle to sort out though... needs to do it in a restricted session
951030ef4480e3a5cc395e77db5bd1ec (19:33): how can i change it in runtime and permanently ?

110c1a65883d95307f347ba8d02c9e52 (19:40): hi folks - i'm tyring to tunnel through to an Oracle server way off in net land... i've set up a port 1521 forwarder, my jdbc url looks correct, but on connect, it pauses 3minutes hten fails with "The Network adapter could not establish the connection" - i'm using hte same JDBC URL that is working on a 'local' install at the office, i've just changed the hostname from their db name to 127.0.0.1.  my ssh -v connection shows a tcpip red
110c1a65883d95307f347ba8d02c9e52 (19:40): irect immediately, but i just never get an answer.

110c1a65883d95307f347ba8d02c9e52 (19:41): is there a way from my end to either telnet to the socket and type something to get an answer (I can telnet, i get the socket connect, but nothing comes back). or is there some other magic (say ports other than 1521) that i need to do?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:49): eidolon: some ssh keep alive jibbrish may be usefull?
110c1a65883d95307f347ba8d02c9e52 (19:50): that would time out a connection after some inactivity.  this isn't even establishing the connection :(
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:52): my local 1521 is already in use
110c1a65883d95307f347ba8d02c9e52 (19:53): i don't have sqlplus... im' on a debian box.
110c1a65883d95307f347ba8d02c9e52 (19:53): i suppose i could try another client... like dbvisualizer or something.
110c1a65883d95307f347ba8d02c9e52 (19:53): is there some magic i can type on the socket to make oracle answer on the other end with -anything-?
110c1a65883d95307f347ba8d02c9e52 (19:58): aha.  dbvisualizer is showing the exact same problem.
110c1a65883d95307f347ba8d02c9e52 (19:58): good, that means it's not my jboss configuration
110c1a65883d95307f347ba8d02c9e52 (20:04): if that's wrong, it should just die immediately, right?  not wait 3 minutes?
